title: Can I study for NEET from JEE books and obtain a good score? - Quora

response.answer_text: yes definitely you can..no issues!! i myself used some of the JEE books such as cengage for jee mains and jee advance (physics) and pradeep for jee mains and jee advance (chemistry)..so u can use books of JEE for PHYSICS and CHEMISTRY but rather i would suggest you to consider referring to MTG books and ARIHANT PUBLICATIONS books as well for NEET because that books are very good for medical entrance exams.. MTG fingertips of all PHYSICS, CHEMISTRY and BIOLOGY are also the standard perfect books!! i myself used all this books..and this all are considered best books for cracking national level medical exam i.e NEET and AIPMT as such! FOR LIST OF BOOKS THAT U CAN REFER FOR NEET AS BEING SPECIFIC ~ http://result.gocareer.in/2016/07/which-books-are-best-to-crack-neet-how.html?m=1 But coming back to ur question , if u refer JEE books for NEET..no problem well and good but all u avoid complex problems in physics as it is not usually asked in NEET as it is asked in JEE mains! ALL THE BEST, MATE! CHEERS!!! thanks for A2A :)

Yes you can but it will be wise if you study the List given below Recommended Books & Study Materials: 1 First and Foremost: - NCERT Text Books & NCERT Exemplar for Class XI & XII 2 Coaching Materials PHYSICS: BANSAL CLASSES CHEMISTRY : VIBRANT ACADEMY MATHS: ALLEN or VIBRANT BIOLOGY: ALLEN or AAKASH 3 Choose your books according to your requirements.     "80-90% Questions asked in Entrance Examinations is from NCERT books." "10-20% Questions asked in Entrance Examinations is from OTHER books."

You can use JEE books for NEET preparation, however it won't be the best idea. Questions in NEET are simpler and and don't require as much maths. You will end up putting in more effort, time which you can use to improve biology or improving your theory part. You should instead solve JEE previous year question banks as revision and as 'final level'.
Are you preparing 2017 NEET ??? Its hardly 9 days to go for NEET test and as of now time asks to revise and relax, kindly concentrate on whatever you burned in your last 1 or 2 years of preparation….
You can use JEE books for physics and chemistry , but leave the heavy numerical in physics and organic chemistry , you can refer the neet books.
Dear Friend Read NCERT books. NCERT books are the best option for preparing NEET or any other medical entrance exam. Most of the questions are asked from NCERT textbook.
Yes. You can study chemistry and physics.
